definition: to give up/to abandon/to give alms
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: making sure that, you know, the building is kept up, building is safe and maintained,
sentences.chinese: 确保宿舍楼内的安全和秩序。

sentences.english: Office part ground and floor are the same to the dormitory's.
sentences.chinese: 办公部分空中与楼面均同宿舍楼。

sentences.english: She lived in my dorm also.
sentences.chinese: 她也住在同一座宿舍楼。

sentences.english: A new dormitory for girl students has been built in our college.
sentences.chinese: 咱们黉舍已经为女生建起了一座新宿舍楼。

sentences.english: Are there enough rooms in the dorms for all of the undergraduate students?
sentences.chinese: 宿舍楼能为所有的本科生提供房间吗？

sentences.english: Those who complain, get moved into Dormitory #2 which is considered the worst one.
sentences.chinese: 学生抱怨说，住进2号宿舍楼是最惨的。

sentences.english: They just went ahead and set off firecrackers in front of dorm buildings or ran naked.
sentences.chinese: 他们只是我行我素地在宿舍楼前放烟花，或是裸奔。

sentences.english: So we actually lived in the same dorm.
sentences.chinese: 我们实际上住在同一幢宿舍楼。

sentences.english: One was five-storey high, and the other one was a building for accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 一个是五层高，另一个是宿舍楼，设施很先进。

sentences.english: Soon we go to a building and dormitory building.
sentences.chinese: 我们很快就去建设和宿舍楼。

definition: building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
